title: Best by far

Excellent

title: Fast, minimalist interface
comment: needs a few more features. My wish is for a 180 degree rotation feature... the english text portion of a user manual is 180 rotated when I load the document. keep reading and the spanish version is upright.

title: Fast!
comment: If you're looking for a FAST, no-frills PDF viewer,  this is it!

title: Best text flow and simple, but missing important features and customization
comment: Tried 12 pdf readers the last two days.  Only one other app had good text flow; most of them break lines in the wrong places when you reflow text, so 4 stars for getting that feature right, but it is really 3 stars for features.  Can't see any way to save preferences so that pdf's open with text flow on and other settings. You have to turn it on each time.  Where is my download from dropbox?  I want it to open the last document I was reading and go to the spot where I left off.  These seem really basic, but I did not see them.

title: Fastest no doubt
comment: Tried other readers for a 50 MB file.. .. this one has surely the fastest rendering engine. ..good job.. .

title: Better then Adobe Reader
comment: The android version opens PDF just as fast as the desktop version. The desktop version is so quick to open PDF's after that double click that it almost feels like I didn't even finish my second click before its open.. Not sure how well it works with more advance PDF's with forms but for reading, it works great.

title: Very nice
comment: This is the best and fastest pdf reader.

title: Very bad UI.
comment: Very bad UI. But it's lightweight and GNU/Free and open source, which is nice.

title: Basically excellent
comment: Could use a slight UI refresh, but the features and responsiveness are solid.

title: The best PDF for reading: fastest, minimal and nice rendering
comment: MuPDF is in fact a free GPL PDF reader component to be integrated into other apps, As a consequence, using it as a standalone app provides a completely minimalist interface (maybe too much for some people), with sort of "medium" or "most used/make sense" predefined configuration values and no possibility to change them directly. On the other hand It opens gigantic PDF files with absolute ease, with ultra-fast loading and page turning - no other app come close to it. Also, the rendering is very good and provides better readable text and images compared to other apps. UPDATE FOR THE DEVELOPERS, after half a year of continuous daily usage: A simple "Recent" list would be very, I mean, VERY much appreciated.

title: The fastest one out there
comment: The only think I wish for are different annotation colors! No need to hardwire them.

comment: If I try to save any annotations it will display the annotations on a blank screen

title: Perfect zoom in scrolling!

title: Nice and fast
comment: Great viewer. Just discovered that tapping on bottom or right side scrolls down and if two columns, will move to next column, then will move to next page. Cool! Would like to see a recent file list and also the  ability to delete files.

title: Pretty good in most respects...
comment: ...but, as with many PDF readers on Android, text selection is horribly cumbersome. Honestly - 4 clicks minimum to imprecisely make a single selection!  Geez! So far, RadaeePDF, despite its own quirks, is the closest to a truly usable PDF reader I've found on Android. MuPdf, Xodo, and maybe Moon+ are close seconds.

title: Fast... And how!
comment: Great little reader that is blazingly fast. Loads quick, minimal interface and just enough. The only thing I would wish for is a zoom and position lock as a toggle on the toolbar, which would be great for tablets and phones that are in a 16:9 aspect ratio to get rid of black bars when zooming in just enough on the actual content. A good 40% and more of most publications is whitespace after all. Thank you for a great little app.

title: =D

title: Best
comment: Best pdf reader for me so far. The only thing i`m not satisfied is that there is no ability to change page when scrolling down. You must swipe right or left to change the page. It would be very nice if you add the ability to scroll down in order to go to the next page too. I`m giving it a 5 star because it`s very good.

title: The best.
comment: This is the best PDF reader I have seen for Android. It loads pages on large, image heavy PDF's very quickly, and when skipping hundreds of pages into large PDF's, where apps like Adobe would take around a minute to start loading the page, MuPDF starts loading immediately and has the page ready to go in about a second or two.   (for reference, I tested with the Pathfinder Core Rulebook, which is 578 pages, 62mb and image heavy )  If this was a paid app I'd buy it right now.

title: Does not work at all

title: Lightweight and fast - 4 stars
comment: I have a preference for open source where available, so I looked at this to replace the official Adobe PDF viewer that came with my tablet.  It's lightweight and quick, and has an equivalent feature set.  It's opened every PDF I've tried it on.  One annoyance: it would be really nice to be able to tell it the default location to be in on startup.  It always starts here in /mnt/sdcard/Downloads, and that's not where I put PDFs.  (They all get stored in an external card under /mnt/extsd/PDFs.) So 4 out of 5 stars.

title: Simple and fast
comment: It's simple, fast and works really well. One thing I would like to see in the future versions is sticky note capability.

title: Fast, light, stunning
comment: This is by far the easiest to use, fastest, and lightest PDF viewer I've used with Android. The clarity of the images is stunning. I've only just begun using it, so may update my rating if I discover any bugs. But so far I'm very pleased.

title: Crashes every time

Quick office, Skitch and MuPDF crashes every single time on my PDFs (files are v1.7, 256-bit AES encrypted etc.). If only I would have any kind of comment on unsupported features, I would understand. But it just force closes...
